DOC.HEAD: Four-Year Yields at Lowest Level Since March 1987
DOC.TEXT: Yields on four-year Treasury notes fell in Wednesday's auction to the lowest level since March 1987. The average yield was 7.65 percent, down from 8.35 percent at the last auction on Oct. 2. It was the lowest rate since four-year notes averaged 6.79 percent on March 25, 1987. The notes will carry a coupon interest rate of 7| percent with each $10,000 in face value selling for $9,991.50. A total of $8.05 billion in notes were sold out of bids totaling $28.03 billion.
